question: What is the introduction content regarding the ACL 2023 conference sponsors?

ACL 2023 is extremely grateful to all sponsors. We simply couldn’t run the conference without the help of these generous organizations. We thank them sincerely for their ongoing support of the NLP/CL community.

If your organization would like to sponsor ACL or other conferences in the ACL family, please refer to our Invitation to Sponsors for information about sponsorship rates and benefits.

question: If I have a main conference paper, is it essential for me to register for the conference?
answer: Yes, as in previous years, you must have at least one author registered per paper for the paper to appear in the proceedings.

question: Why am I required to have a SOFTCONF profile in order to submit a paper to the conference?
answer: SOFTCONF profiles are used to help identify conflicts, so every author (not just the submitting author) needs to have a SOFTCONF profile.

question: Can I change the type of my submission, from a short paper to a long paper, after the abstract deadline?
answer: Yes, changing the submission type doesn’t affect the number or type of reviewers, so this is fine.

question: Can I submit the same paper to another conference that is currently under review elsewhere (e.g. at EACL)?
answer: EACL’s notification deadline is right after ACL’s submission deadline. If you withdraw your paper within 24 hours of the other conference’s notification (assuming it is accepted), this brief period of double submission is acceptable. No other double submissions are allowed.

question: Is it possible to present my paper virtually at the main conference and the workshops, or to participate in the conference virtually?
answer: Yes, all participants will have the option to attend the conference virtually.

question: What is the full name of the event abbreviate as ACL held in Toronto, Canada in 2023?
answer: Association for Computational Linguistics

question: What is the last news update made for ACL2023 and what does it concern?
answer: The last update was made on June 2, 2023: Conference Program is posted under the Program.

question: When is the date for early registration for the ACL2023 event?
answer: The early registration date for the event is June 18, 2023.

question: What is the schedule for the conference and the workshops at the ACL 2023?
answer: The conference is scheduled from July 10-12, 2023, and the workshops are scheduled from July 13-14, 2023.

question: When is the first call for main conference papers made for ACL2023 ?
answer: The first call for main conference papers was made on October 7, 2022.

question: What is the new award policy implemented by ACL2023?
answer: ACL2023 implemented a new award policy which aims for broader recognition of exceptional research, in particular by significantly increasing the pool of outstanding papers to 1.5-2.5% of the total submissions.

question: What are the categories of special awards introduced in ACL2023?
answer: There are 4 special awards introduced in ACL2023: Resource Award, Social Impact Award, Reproduction Award, Theme Paper Award.

question: What incentives do ACL2023 provide for the reviewers?
answer: ACL2023 provides a fee waiver for any *ACL virtual conference, to be used within a year of the award, as an incentive for the reviewers.

question: What kind of reviewers were recognized for the reviewer awards?
answer: Reviewers providing extra helpful reviews or high-quality emergency reviews, 'champion' reviewers, and reviewers who were particularly active in the discussion phase, and demonstrated exceptional open-mindedness or expertise were recognized for the reviewer awards.

question: What is the scope of ACL reviewer awards?
answer: The scope of the ACL reviewer awards is comparable to the best paper awards policy (1-1.5% of the pool of reviewers and chairs).

question: What is the goal of the ACL 2023 Student Research Workshop?
answer: The workshop’s goal is to aid students at multiple stages of their education, including undergraduate, MSc/MA, junior and senior PhD students, in getting familiar with conducting and presenting their research.

question: Can a student submit a paper to SRW without participating in the pre-submission mentorship program?
answer: Yes, a student can submit a paper at the SRW submission deadline even if they did not participate in the pre-submission mentoring.

question: Is extra space allowed after the 8th page or the 4th page for short papers?
answer: Yes, extra space is allowed after the 8th page for a limitation section and an ethics/broader impact statement. Similarly, extra space can be added after the 4th page for short papers.

question: When submitting a long paper, what is the maximum number of pages allowed, including extra sections like limitations and ethical considerations, but excluding acknowledgments and references?

question: Where should the sections on limitations and ethical considerations be placed in the submitted version of the paper?

question: If I need high-speed internet access for the duration of the conference, can the conference cover the cost?

question: What are the important dates regarding the student volunteer program at ACL 2023 conference?
answer: The application deadline for the student volunteer program is on May 31, 2023 and the notification of acceptance will be on June 5, 2023.

question: What is the selection criteria for the student volunteer program in ACL 2023?
answer: Applicants for the Student Volunteer Program will be evaluated based on the material submitted in the application package. Preference will be given to students who are presenting a paper at the main conference or any of the associated workshops and do not have other means of travel support.

question: What tasks may student volunteers be required to do for ACL 2023?
answer: Tasks may include assisting at the registration desk, filling delegate packs, managing poster board sessions and displays, serving as volunteer coordinator for the day, and/or AV/technical support such as managing social media and providing assistance for conference events including tutorials, the main conference, and workshops.

question: What should you do if you are not accepted in the student volunteer program but you have already registered for the ACL 2023 conference?
answer: The Registrar will work with you to secure early registration fee rates. If a student requires reimbursement after the conference for late volunteer registration, the student must provide receipt of paid registration fees from debit or bank account to the ACL Assistant Director of Events, Megs Haddad.

question: Who are the student volunteer chairs for ACL2023 and how can they be contacted?
answer: The student volunteer chairs are Tao Yu from the University of Hong Kong and Ayah Zirikly from Johns Hopkins University. They can be contacted at tyu@cs.hku.hk and Ayah.zirikly@gmail.com respectively.

question: What are some of Geoffrey Hinton's professional recognitions?
answer: He is a fellow of the UK Royal Society, a foreign member of the US National Academy of Engineering, the US National Academy of Sciences, and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences among others. His awards include the David E. Rumelhart prize, the IJCAI award for research excellence, the Killam prize for Engineering, the Royal Society Royal Medal, the NSERC Herzberg Gold Medal, and the Turing Award among others.

question: Where will the social programs associated with ACL 2023 take place, and when?
answer: At Steam Whistle Brewing / Canada’s Premium Beer on July 11th from 7:00 PM to 10:30 PM

question: What is Alison Gopnik’s area of expertise, and what important contributions has she made to her field?
answer: Alison Gopnik is a professor of psychology and affiliate professor of philosophy at the University of California at Berkeley, and a member of the Berkeley AI Research Group. She is a leader in the study of cognitive science and of children’s learning and development and was one of the founders of the field of “theory of mind”, an originator of the “theory of cognitive development”, and the first to apply Bayesian probabilistic models to children’s learning.

question: What are the potential topics of interest for the Industry Track at ACL 2023?
answer: Topics of interest include Best practices and lessons learned, Continuous maintenance and improvement of deployed systems, Case studies from design to deployment, Design of application-relevant datasets, and Ethics and bias in deployed NLP systems among others.

question: What are some of the important deadlines for the ACL 2023 Industry Track?
answer: Some important deadlines are: Anonymity period begins on January 17, 2023, Paper submission deadline is on February 17, 2023 and Notification of acceptance is on May 8, 2023.

question: What is the multiple submission policy of the ACL 2023?
answer: ACL 2023 will not consider any paper that is under review in a journal or another conference at the time of submission, and submitted papers must not be submitted elsewhere during the ACL 2023 review period. This policy covers all refereed and archival conferences and workshops, as well as ACL Rolling Reviews (ARR).
from: ACL2023>>Calls>>CALL FOR PAPERS>>Industry Track>>content>>Multiple Submission Policy

question: When and where will the ACL 2023 Conference take place?
answer: The ACL 2023 Conference will take place in Toronto, Canada from July 9-14, 2023.

question: What is the submission deadline for the Workshop Proposals for the EACL/ACL/EMNLP 2023?
answer: The submission deadline for the Workshop Proposals for the EACL/ACL/EMNLP 2023 is November 15, 2022.

question: What kind of proposals are invited for the tutorials at the EACL 2023, ACL 2023, and EMNLP 2023 conferences?
answer: Proposals are invited for two types of tutorials: Cutting-edge and Introductory. Cutting-edge tutorials cover advances in newly emerging areas not previously covered in any ACL/EMNLP/EACL/NAACL-HLT/AACL/COLING related tutorial while Introductory tutorials provide introductions to related fields that are potentially relevant for the computational linguistics community.

question: What are the responsibilities of the organizers of the accepted proposals?
answer: The organizers of the accepted proposals will be responsible for publicizing and running the workshop, including reviewing submissions, producing the camera-ready workshop proceedings, organizing the meeting days, and playing their part to ensure that all participants are aware of ACL’s anti-harassment policy.

question: What is the fee waiving policy for the tutorial presenters at the EACL 2023, ACL 2023, and EMNLP 2023 conferences?
answer: Up to 3 instructors per tutorial can have their registration fees waived for the main conference and any subset of co-located tutorials and workshops.

question: What is the deadline for paper submission for the System Demonstration track at ACL 2023?
answer: February 24, 2023

question: What are the guidelines about video submission for the system demonstration?
answer: A short (max. 2 minutes) video demonstrating the system is required for submission. This video should ideally be a screencast of the software being demonstrated. The production quality of the video is not a deciding factor. Videos can be published on platforms like YouTube and the link can be included in the paper. If the authors prefer not to publicly upload a screencast, the video can be submitted in MPEG4 format as supplementary material.

question: What is the policy regarding overlap of content between multiple demo papers submitted by the same author to ACL 2023?
answer: Authors submitting more than one demo paper to ACL 2023 must ensure that the submissions do not overlap significantly (>25%) with each other. Submissions of identical or closely related work to multiple tracks at ACL 2023 will be rejected by all tracks.

question: What is the maximum length of the papers for the system demonstrations and what happens to the papers that do not follow the page limits?
answer: The papers must be no more than six (6) pages long, besides the optional ethics/broader impact statement and references which get unlimited space. Accepted papers are given one additional page of content for addressing reviewers’ comments. Any papers that do not follow the official style guidelines and page limits will be automatically rejected.

question: Who do we contact for any queries regarding ACL 2023 System Demonstration track?
answer: The System Demonstration Chairs can be contacted at acl2023demochairs@gmail.com. The chairs are Danushka Bollegala from Amazon/University of Liverpool (UK), Ruihong Huang from Texas A&M University (USA), and Alan Ritter from Georgia Institute of Technology (USA).
from: ACL2023>>Calls>>CALL FOR PAPERS>>System Demonstration>>content>>System Demonstration Chairs

question: What is the policy on multiple submission for papers under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023?
answer: A work under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023 can be submitted to ACL, but must be declared at submission time. If the work is accepted, it must be withdrawn from ACL no later than January 31 (when accepted to EACL 2023) and no later than January 22 (when accepted to ICLR 2023)
from: ACL2023>>Calls>>CALL FOR PAPERS>>Main Conference>>content>>Paper Submission Policies>>content>>Multiple Submission Policy

question: What are the possible topics for discussion under the theme track 'Reality Check'?
answer: How reliably do the leaderboard scores translate to improvements in real-world use of the models? How reliably do the leaderboard scores compare competing models? While the current NLP systems are not brittle in the same way as their predecessors, they are still brittle in other ways. What tasks can we claim to have “solved”, if any? Have performance improvements been accompanied by commensurate growth in the scientific understanding (of language, cognition, or deep learning technology)? In what ways? Given that the authors of engineering papers are incentivized to report only the most successful results, especially for the systems that are also commercial products, what can the NLP venues do to improve reporting?
from: ACL2023>>Calls>>CALL FOR PAPERS>>Main Conference>>content>>Theme Track: Reality Check>>content

question: What is the submission deadline for papers submitted to ARR for the ACL 2023 conference?
answer: December 15, 2022

question: What are the requirements for the mandatory abstract submission?
answer: The paper title, author names, contact details, and a brief abstract must be submitted electronically through the ACL 2023 paper submission site by the abstract submission deadline (January 13). It will be possible to make minor edits to the title and abstract until the full paper submission deadline, but you cannot change authors and subject areas. Submissions with “placeholder” abstracts will be removed without consideration. If you miss the abstract submission deadline, then you cannot submit the full paper.
from: ACL2023>>Calls>>CALL FOR PAPERS>>Main Conference>>content>>Mandatory abstract submission>>content

question: What are the ethical considerations for paper submissions?
answer: Authors are required to honor the ethical code set out in the ACL Code of Ethics. ACL 2023 will incorporate the Responsible NLP Research checklist into the reviewing process and it should accompany all submissions. Moreover, an explicit ethics statement on the broader impact of the work, or other ethical considerations should be included after the conclusion but before the references.

question: What is the Association for Computational Linguistics?
answer: The Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL) is the premier international scientific and professional society for people working on computational problems involving human language, a field often referred to as either computational linguistics or natural language processing (NLP). The association was founded in 1962, originally named the Association for Machine Translation and Computational Linguistics (AMTCL), and became the ACL in 1968. Activities of the ACL include the holding of an annual meeting each summer and the sponsoring of the journal Computational Linguistics, published by MIT Press; this conference and journal are the leading publications of the field.
from: ACL2023>>Participants>>Participants Information>>About ACL>>content>>What is the ACL and what is Computational Linguistics?

question: How can one obtain an invitation letter for the ACL 2023 conference?
answer: You can apply for an invitation letter for obtaining a VISA for ACL 2023 in this form if you have submitted a paper to the main conference ACL 2023 as an author (including co-authors) and your Softconf ID is associated with the submission.

question: What is the anti-harassment policy at ACL events?
answer: Harassment and hostile behavior are unwelcome at any ACL conference, associated event, or in ACL-affiliated online discussions. This includes speech or behavior that intimidates, creates discomfort, or interferes with a person’s participation or opportunity for participation in a conference or an event. Harassment includes degrading verbal comments, deliberate intimidation, stalking, harassing photography or recording, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention. The policy is not intended to inhibit challenging scientific debate, but rather to promote it by ensuring that all are welcome to participate in the shared spirit of scientific inquiry. Vexatious complaints and willful misuse of this procedure will render the complainant subject to the same sanctions as a violation of the anti-harassment policy.
from: ACL2023>>Participants>>Participants Information>>Ethical Policies>>content>>ACL Code of Conduct

question: What is the refund policy for the registration fee if a participant cancels one month prior to the conference?
answer: Cancellation of registration one month or more prior to the conference (June 09, 2023, or before), will be refunded the full amount paid. (Minus up to $50 processing fee)

question: What areas are computational linguists work incorporated today?
answer: The work of computational linguists is incorporated into many working systems today, including speech recognition systems, text-to-speech synthesizers, automated voice response systems, web search engines, text editors, language instruction materials, to name just a few.
from: ACL2023>>Participants>>Participants Information>>About ACL>>content>>What is Computational Linguistics?

question: What does the Full Conference In-person Registration Fee Include?
answer: Admission to all in-person Meeting sessions and the exhibition as well as the entire virtual program, Conference Bag and Materials, Tea and coffee breaks throughout the Meeting, Admission to the Welcome Reception on Sunday 9th of July at The Westin Harbour Castle, Metropolitan Ballroom including light canapes and a welcome drink, Admission to the Social Dinner on Tuesday 11th July at The Steam Whistle Brewer, including buffet dinner, Attendance to all recorded sessions on demand for at least one month following the Meeting.
from: ACL2023>>Registration>>Registration>>content>>The Full Conference In-person Registration Fee Includes

question: What are the time boundaries for early registration, late registration and on-site registration?
answer: Early registration will end on Sunday, June 18, 2023, 11:59 PM (EDT). Late registration starts Monday, June 19 and ends Friday, July 7, 2023, 11:59 PM (EDT). On-site registration begins Saturday, July 8, 2023.

question: What are the prices for the different virtual registration categories?
answer: Full Conference Regular Early is $300.00, Full Conference Regular Late is $450.00, Full Conference Regular Onsite is $550.00, Full Conference Student Early is $150.00, Full Conference Student Late is $225.00, Full Conference Student Onsite is $250.00. Tutorial Only - Regular Early is $40.00, Tutorial Only - Regular Late/Onsite is $60.00, Tutorial Only - Student Early is $20.00, Tutorial Only - Student Late/Onsite is $30.00. Workshops Only (2days) - Regular Early is $65.00, Workshops Only (2days) - Regular Late/Onsite is $85.00, Workshops Only (2days) - Student Early is $40.00, Workshops Only (2days) - Student Late/Onsite is $60.00.

question: What is the cancelation policy of the conference?
answer: Cancellation of registration one month or more prior to the conference (June 09, 2023, or before), will be refunded the full amount paid. (Minus up to $50 processing fee) Cancellations up to three weeks prior to the conference (June 16, 2023) will be refunded the ACL membership and any amounts paid over and above the first $200. Cancellations 2 weeks prior to start of Conference (June 23, 2023), and all no-shows, will not be refunded any amount.

question: Who are the intended recipients for Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration?
answer: Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration is intended to make ACL events accessible to researchers who otherwise would be unable to participate. It's particularly intended for individuals in greatest financial need and not for employed individuals and funded students from USA, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand and higher income countries in Asia and the Middle East.
